intro: Maytenus chilensis, commonly known as the Chilean mayten, is a deciduous tree native to southern South America. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. It thrives in dry, temperate climates and is often found in shrublands and forests. Its wood is hard and has been traditionally used for crafting and construction.
